Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2022
Comment:
I have probably 5 or 6 of these now. Not because they go bad, but because I buy them for others. The app can be annoying when it updates, but it's super simple to use and apply macros to the side buttons. For work I use the top two on the left to Zoom in and out of PDFs, and also to add and remove lines in excel. I use the two sides of the scroll wheel for copy / paste, and have changed the DPI / profile switch(er) to be my print button.

The only issue I've had is my home (gaming) mouse that I bought 2nd hand 3 years ago is starting to double click on the right mouse button. It could just be dirty, but I haven't had it happen continuously, just off and on at random times in game (maybe just double clicking due to input lag of the game) Even for day to day use, I love the ergonomics of this. You could say I'm a fan boy lol.

Comment: This is just the based wired gaming mouse. I'm not sure what else to say. It's light and fast. If you want the best wired gaming mouse, to me, this is it

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2022
Comment: I've been using a Performance MX since 2014, and finally decided to upgrade. I split my computer time between programming and gaming, so I was used to having a pretty heavy mouse. I put all of the weights in when I got this and it feels just like my old mouse. The G502 has way more buttons than my old Performance MX, which is great for keymapping on games. I don't personally like high DPI, since I don't play a lot of FPS games, but the DPI has a variable range that's good for just about anything. The glowing G logo is customizable within the Logitech software, as are the button mappings. Great mouse all around

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019
Comment:
Refurb quality: only very minor scuffs on the pads, nothing that would catch or looked well-worn. Buttons and hand rests are clean and the buttons and wheel move and click smoothly. The hand rests are actually impressively clean given that their texture seems likely to make it hard to truly clean them.

Product quality: Bought this to replace a cheap gaming mouse I'd had before, which developed issues in months. I'm a little leery of Logitech's reliability (a couple past mice developed various problems), but so far it's been a great purchase. I love the ability to toggle between clicky and free-spin on the wheel, they assortment of buttons, the sensitivity, the adjustable weight, and the look. The software is also quite good. Ergonomics-wise, I wish the mouse was a little bigger - I have big hands, so this won't be a problem for most people - because it's a slightly awkward tradeoff between being able to hold the mouse comfortably and being able to reach even most of the buttons comfortably. Overall, though, it's a great mouse for gaming, productivity, and general computer use, and the price is very good for a mouse of this design.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
Comment: Love this mouse and the customizability of the buttons. Bought forever ago and has held up daily use in gaming and daily work tasks. Love it and will be buying the wireless version of this when it dies.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2023
Comment:
Got a pretty good deal on this, about $35 for an example with "Refurbished - Excellent Condition". Refurbished items can be hit or miss but excellent condition is quite accurate this time around!

The mouse feels brand new, the bearings on the scroll wheel are super smooth, it came with a brand new set of weights and a simple manual. NOT in the original box, but I personally don't care. Definitely happy with the order.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
Comment: This is a great mouse! The super scroll feature allows me to scroll through code super fast. 1 flick of the scroll wheel and you can be a thousand lines down. This can be turned on/off with a switch behind the scroll wheel. All buttons are programmable for gaming or applications. Highly recommend!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2022
Comment:
I got three G502 in total, all refurbished. I highly recommend you get them from the vendor CrownProducts. The quality from my first unit to my second unit was abysmal, with lousy switches, and rattly buttons. I noticed the vendors were different, so I returned the mediocre one and got the rest from the first vendor. All the mice I got from CrownProducts are in excellent condition.

You may receive lame mice as other reviewers are complaining about depending on the seller. Please share good vendors in your reviews =)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2019
Comment:
This mouse is by far the best I have ever owned or used. It glides with no resistance and the included weight set helps make the perfect feel.
A button on top selects the dpi and RGB color cycle of the 'G' located at the palm. If the length were just a 'tad' shorter, it would be a 10/10 for my small hands. That being said, I am VERY happy with my purchase.

On a side note, it came very poorly packaged. Mine came renewed, so it came in an odd weak box which is fine, but it was shipped in a soft plastic type envelope (like small items usually ship in). Enviablely, the box got crushed. I was certain the mouse was damaged, but much to my surprise, it was fine. Over all, it's the best mouse with the best feel and ergonomics that looks galactic. I love it.

I'm a little leery of Logitech's reliability (a couple past mice developed various problems), but so far it's been a great purchase. I love the ability to toggle between clicky and free-spin on the wheel, they assortment of buttons, the sensitivity, the adjustable weight, and the look. The software is also quite good. Ergonomics-wise, I wish the mouse was a little bigger - I have big hands, so this won't be a problem for most people - because it's a slightly awkward tradeoff between being able to hold the mouse comfortably and being able to reach even most of the buttons comfortably. Overall, though, it's a great mouse for gaming, productivity, and general computer use, and the price is very good for a mouse of this design.

Comment: Love this mouse and the customizability of the buttons. Bought forever ago and has held up daily use in gaming and daily work tasks. Love it and will be buying the wireless version of this when it dies.

Comment:
Got a pretty good deal on this, about $35 for an example with "Refurbished - Excellent Condition". Refurbished items can be hit or miss but excellent condition is quite accurate this time around!

The mouse feels brand new, the bearings on the scroll wheel are super smooth, it came with a brand new set of weights and a simple manual. NOT in the original box, but I personally don't care. Definitely happy with the order.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2022
Comment:
I got three G502 in total, all refurbished. I highly recommend you get them from the vendor CrownProducts. The quality from my first unit to my second unit was abysmal, with lousy switches, and rattly buttons. I noticed the vendors were different, so I returned the mediocre one and got the rest from the first vendor. All the mice I got from CrownProducts are in excellent condition.

You may receive lame mice as other reviewers are complaining about depending on the seller. Please share good vendors in your reviews =)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2019
Comment:
This mouse is by far the best I have ever owned or used. It glides with no resistance and the included weight set helps make the perfect feel.
A button on top selects the dpi and RGB color cycle of the 'G' located at the palm. If the length were just a 'tad' shorter, it would be a 10/10 for my small hands. That being said, I am VERY happy with my purchase.

On a side note, it came very poorly packaged. Mine came renewed, so it came in an odd weak box which is fine, but it was shipped in a soft plastic type envelope (like small items usually ship in). Enviablely, the box got crushed. I was certain the mouse was damaged, but much to my surprise, it was fine. Over all, it's the best mouse with the best feel and ergonomics that looks galactic. I love it.
